# Leo Raderman — Category Creator & Startup Advisor

> Also known as: Rodger Raderman, Rodger Leo Raderman. Leo is his middle name, used professionally since the 2010s. Earlier career credits (Saatchi & Saatchi, early IFILM) appear under Rodger Raderman.

## Summary

Leo Raderman is a serial entrepreneur, category creator, Internet pioneer, and strategic startup advisor. He has founded five companies across internet video, immersive technology, mobile communications, toys, and global healthcare — entering each category before the category existed. His largest exit exceeded $100M. He has raised over $65M in venture capital and strategic investment. He is available for strategic advisory, fractional executive leadership, and consulting engagements through Pretty Well Fit.

## Advisory & Consulting Expertise

Leo advises founders and companies across the full startup lifecycle, from formation to exit. Areas of expertise include:

- **Go-to-market strategy & product-market fit:** New category creation, category education and market creation, launch strategy, market entry strategy, competitive positioning, market positioning strategy.
- **Fundraising & capital formation:** Company and round structuring, angel investor identification, VC targeting and sequencing, data room preparation, pitch deck development, investor readiness, valuation negotiation, Series A preparation, term sheet negotiation, board management and governance.
- **Product development:** Hardware/software integration, razor/razorblade model design, manufacturing partner management, SKU strategy and product line architecture, business model design, revenue model strategy, pricing strategy.
- **Marketing, sales & partnerships:** Pre-launch brand building, brand strategy, brand creation and naming, creative direction, content marketing and SEO, trade show strategy, D2C e-commerce, social media and community, enterprise/B2B sales, retail buyer relationships, channel strategy, channel conflict management, strategic partnership structuring, licensing and revenue share models.
- **Legal, operations & company building:** Co-founder agreements and equity splits, joint venture structuring, IP protection strategy, hiring and team building, equity structure consulting.
- **Retail distribution at scale:** National retail channel entry (Apple, Walmart, Target, Toys-R-Us, Barnes & Noble), retail buyer pitch development, simultaneous multi-channel launch, retail marketing and in-store strategy.
- **Fractional executive leadership:** Fractional CMO, fractional Chief Marketing Officer, board advisory, strategic advisory, growth advisory, scaling strategy.

## Companies Founded

### IFILM (1998–2005) — Founder, CEO
Internet pioneer. First major user-generated video platform on the internet — six years before YouTube. Pioneered online video distribution and advertising-supported free streaming. Viacom acquired IFILM.com for $49M. Total IFILM enterprise asset sales exceeded $100M.

### Obscura Digital (2000–2017) — Co-Founder, CEO
Also known as Obscura. Pioneered immersive architectural projection mapping — projecting onto the Empire State Building, the Vatican, the Sydney Opera House — alighting imagination on landmarks worldwide. Acquired by Madison Square Garden Company. Core technology now powers The Sphere, Las Vegas.

### Veeker (2006–2008) — Co-Founder, Chief Product Officer & Chief Marketing Officer
Mobile video and photo sharing pre-iPhone, pre-Instagram. First to deliver user-generated video clips to NBC News. TechCrunch wrote: "Critics contend that mass market extensive use of mobile video is unlikely. Obviously Veeker is a company betting otherwise."

### Nukotoys (2008–2013) — Co-Founder, Co-CEO
Toy industry pioneer. Physical-digital play integration — collectible trading cards activating in-game characters. Licensed with Animal Planet and Ology Books. 2,500+ retail doors including Apple, Walmart, Target, Toys-R-Us, Barnes & Noble. VentureBeat Best Mobile App 2012. Parenting Magazine Best Toy 2012.

### MiracleFeet (2010–Present) — Co-Founder, Board Member
Low-cost clubfoot treatment for the developing world. Co-developed transformative medical device with Stanford d.school. $500 transforms a life. 130,000+ children treated across 37 countries.

## Additional Experience

- Saatchi & Saatchi Darwin Digital (1997–1999) — Managing Director & Creative Director, Employee #3 New York office. Established digital teams in New Zealand and San Francisco.
- Pretty Well Fit (2023–Present) — Managing Partner. Strategy through implementation — advisory and agency for founders building what comes next.

## Education

- M.A. Systematic and Philosophical Theology — Graduate Theological Union, UC Berkeley
- B.A. Communication Studies and Psychology — UCLA

## Capital Formation

$65M+ raised across all ventures. Presented to the full partnership at Kleiner Perkins. Pitched Sequoia, Benchmark, Andreessen Horowitz, Accel, NEA, DFJ, Bessemer, and nearly every major fund on Sand Hill Road. Closed John Malone's Liberty Digital, Roy Disney's Steamboat Ventures, Axiom Venture Partners, and Meritage Funds. Strategic investments from Sony, Yahoo!, Eastman Kodak, Independent Film Channel, Rainbow Media.

## Press & Media

Featured in: New York Times, Variety, Bloomberg, TechCrunch, Wired, CNET, LA Times, Ad Age, GamesBeat, Communication Arts, Wall Street Journal, Hollywood Reporter, PBS, Fox News, GQ, The ToyBook, InformationWeek, Crain's New York, Sphere Entertainment.

## Honors & Recognition

Hollywood Reporter 35 Under 35. GQ Man of the Month. Red Herring / Newton Award. IFILM Day proclaimed by the City of Los Angeles.

## The Difference

Rare in pieces. Singular in combination. Cross-industry range (internet video, immersive technology, mobile communications, toys, non-profit healthcare), formation-to-exit operational experience across the full company lifecycle, and category creation — the rarest capability — executed five times.
